item.title: Cigarette butt believed to be cause of Perth bushfire
item.description: Authorities believe a bushfire that threatened homes in Perth was accidentally started by a cigarette butt.﻿

item.title: Brothers and parents found dead suspected double murder-suicide in Perth
item.description: Two teenage brothers are believed to have been killed by their parents in a double murder-suicide in Perth's west.

item.title: 'Horrendously bumpy': Wild winds force Qantas flight to Adelaide to divert to Defence Force base
item.description: A Qantas flight bound for South Australia was forced to touch down at a Defence Force base last night after extreme winds forced pilots to abandon their landing at Adelaide Airport.﻿

item.title: Police reveal more human remains and clothes found in search for missing Belgian tourist Celine Cremer
item.description: Tasmanian police have discovered more human remains along with items of clothing, which they believe belonged to missing Belgian tourist Celine Cremer.

item.title: SA minister Chris Picton 'beyond angry' over death of brother Tim Picton in alleged one-punch attack
item.description: South Australian Health Minister Chris Picton has given his first interview since the death of his brother Tim after an alleged one-punch attack in Perth.

item.title: Luigi Mangione will not face death penalty, judge rules
item.description: Luigi Mangione will not face the death penalty for allegedly killing UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson in December 2024, a federal district judge ruled.

item.title: Today in History - January 31: Bank robber brought undone by notorious Aussie traffic bottleneck
item.description: Notorious Australian bank robber Hakki 'Tim' Atahan, was shot dead by police in Sydney on January 31, 1984, after a bizarre car chase through the city.

item.title: Dragging Melbourne roadworks threaten to force locals out of business
item.description: Rebekah Becsi fears she'll have to close down her discount food store in a matter of weeks.

item.title: Man and woman injured following stabbing in Sydney's west
item.description: A﻿ 24-year-old man has been arrested however, charges are yet to be laid.

item.title: Man charged after allegedly stolen car crashes into school bus after driving towards officers in Geelong
item.description: The car allegedly attempted to flee the scene before backing into a school bus and driving towards police.

item.title: Elon Musk asked to visit Jeffrey Epstein's island for his 'wildest party'
item.description: Elon Musk reached out to financier and sex criminal Jeffrey Epstein on at least two separate occasions to plan visits to his private island.

item.title: Journalist Don Lemon charged with federal civil rights crimes after covering anti-ICE church protest
item.description: Lemon was in Los Angeles to cover the Grammy Awards and was arrested after 11pm local time in a hotel lobby in Beverley Hills as he was leaving for an event.

item.title: Justice Department releases largest batch yet of Epstein documents, says it totals three million pages
item.description: Officials at the FBI compiled a list of sexual assault allegations related to US President Donald Trump this past August, many of which appear to have come from unverified tips.

item.title: Why does it smell like smoke in Sydney and northern NSW?
item.description: Thousands of NSW residents have woken up to the smell of smoke.﻿

item.title: Catherine O'Hara, star of Home Alone and Schitt's Creek, dies aged 71
item.description: The Home Alone and Schitt's Creek star﻿ died in Los Angeles "following a brief illness", with audio from paramedics revealing she was having difficulty breathing.

item.title: Barbecue explosion on NSW south coast leaves four people in hospital
item.description: A man his in his 30s was airlifted to Wollongong hospital in a stable condition with facial injuries.

item.title: Violent brawl takes over Adelaide street
item.description: Residents of a South Australian community have been forced to lock themselves inside their homes after a brawl broke out on their street.

item.title: Two women detail scary encounter with alleged triple murderer Julian Ingram
item.description: Two of the last people to come face-to-face with ﻿alleged triple murderer Julian Ingram have opened up about their brief encounter with the fugitive.

item.title: Queensland charity founder Yas Matbouly faces 51 charges, accused of sexually assaulting multiple women
item.description: The founder of a well-known Queensland charity supporting the homeless has today fronted court accused of sexually assaulting multiple women.

item.title: Alleged Disney casting agent charged with child prostitution after allegedly luring young actors with fake opp
item.description: A man accused of posing as a Disney casting agent has faced court, accused of luring young actors with fake opportunities in exchange for sexual favours.

item.title: South African expats urged to renew passports following citizenship court ruling
item.description: A court ruling may now impact travel for tens of thousands﻿ of South Africans living in Australia.

item.title: Today in History - February 1: US state bans hit song for its offensive lyrics, which nobody could understand
item.description: The rock and roll smash hit Louie Louie was banned from being played on the radio in Indiana on February 1, 1964, on the order of Governor Matthew Welsh.

item.title: Investigation under way after glass fire bombs thrown at Sydney home in 'targeted' attack
item.description: A person riding a scooter was spotted riding nearby immediately after the bottles were thrown.

item.title: Latest Epstein file photos appear to show former Prince Andrew on floor with woman
item.description: In one undated image, Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor looks directly at the camera as he crouches over the fully clothed figure, whose face has been obscured.

item.title: NSW government to scrap 'good character' references for convicted criminals
item.description: "﻿Victim survivors shouldn't have to sit in court and hear the person who hurt them or their loved one described as a 'good person'."

item.title: Second note found by police after teenage brothers and parents found dead in double murder-suicide
item.description: Friends of Mai and Jarrod Clune say the couple were at breaking point as they struggled to look after their sons who lived with severe autism.

item.title: Sydneysiders wake to thick blanket of smoke after overnight bushfires on Mid North Coast
item.description: Overnight bushfires still burning near Port Stephens and Nerong caused ﻿smoke to drift south down the coast across the Hunter Valley, Newcastle, the Central Coast and into Sydney.

item.title: Nationals leader David Littleproud 'pretty safe' ahead of looming leadership spill
item.description: "Colin Boyce would admit, I think if put into some kind of honesty chamber, that he's not going to win this challenge,"

item.title: Epstein survivors condemn Department of Justice for exposing identities of victims in latest file release
item.description: The final release of millions of Epstein documents ﻿includes 180,000 images and 2000 videos.

item.title: Deputy NSW Premier Prue Car to return to state parliament following breast cancer battle
item.description: Car, who is also the Minister for Education and Early Learning, stepped back from the job in June last year to undergo treatment for breast cancer.

item.title: Parents of Sydney Harbour shark attack victim, 12, join poignant Bondi paddle out
item.description: More than 100 surfers took to the waves of North Bondi to pay tribute to the Sydney schoolboy.

item.title: British man in his 70s arrested over alleged cruise ship assault
item.description: A﻿ British man aged 71 has been arrested after allegedly assaulting somebody on a cruise ship.

item.title: Two children fighting for life after house fire in Townsville
item.description: Authorities were forced to smash the top floor window to enter the flaming building and pull out the girls, aged two and 13.

item.title: Cyclist, 27, dies after BMX accident on first day of riding
item.description: A man has died after crashing his bike at a skate park in Adelaide.﻿

item.title: Search launched for missing swimmer in Sydney's south
item.description: A search is under way for a man who disappeared at ﻿Maroubra Beach in Sydney.

item.title: Judge orders five-year-old Liam Ramos and his father be released from US immigration detention
